metadata.title: Free-drifting Sediment Trap Array (FDSTAr) at Station Papa, 1998-present
metadata.description: Data from free-drifting sediment traps deployed at Ocean Station Papa, for short periods of time, three times per year, 19xx to 2000 (continuing)
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Quantity and composition of particle flux from upper layers of open ocean.

Supplemental Information: Risk Justification: Custodian will be leaving soon and has a large quantity of data not secured in a regional data centre.
Risk of Loss: High
Impact Justification: Long term time series (more than 10 years)
Impact of Loss: High
Recommended Action: Obtain access to the data bring to archives.

Status: In work

Maintenance frequency: None planned

Access constraints: Private

Use constraints: Data have not been published, not quality checked.

Distribution liability: [unknown]

FGDC metadata date: 20080207

FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

FGDC metadata version: FGDC-STD-1998-1

Native data set environment: Expected Growth Rate: Null

Data quality - Logical consistency: For C:N, biogenic silicate, CaCO3: subsamples of a sample collected at station papa (a historical sample) are analyzed with each set of data to check for continuity. Zooplankton that may have swum into the trap are removed by hand. Silicate concentrations are compared to prepared standards.
Data quality - Completeness: Dataset Complications: Some gaps in the data due to trap malfunction.
Lineage - Process steps:
  1. IOS and UBC collaborative project

Distribution liability: [unknown]
Non-digital ordering: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y
Hardcopy Locations: Janet Barwell-Clarke, Rm 1408, IOS
Hardcopy Description: Binders of raw data and deck sheets.
Fees: Ask Custodian

FGDC metadata date: 20080207
FGDC metadata standard: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata (version: FGDC-STD-1998-1)
